occupation: Year-Round Intern QA Enterprise Technology at OCC
headline: Year-Round Intern QA Enterprise Technology at OCC | Grad Student at Illinois Tech
summary: I am a dedicated and forward-thinking Master's student at Illinois Institute of Technology, specializing in Data Analytics. With a solid foundation in Information Technology Management and over two years of hands-on experience in the IT industry as a Software QA Engineer, I bring a unique blend of skills and knowledge to the table.

experiences.title: Student Assistant
experiences.description:
-Proctored examinations for over 200+ students, ensuring a fair and secure testing environment.
-Utilized database management software such as FileMaker and Microsoft Excel to accurately and efficiently maintain student records and information.
-Communicated clearly and effectively with students and parents as check-in staff, explaining rules and regulations.

experiences.title: Year-Round Intern QA Enterprise Technology
experiences.description:
-Collaborated with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality enterprise applications on Appian technology.
-Implementing Agile methodologies and utilizes tools like JIRA,Spira and Postman for efficient project management.
-Conducting comprehensive testing, re-testing, and contributes to ongoing maintenance efforts.
- Playing a key role in validating new updates, ensuring software aligns with evolving business needs.

experiences.title: Associate Academic Coach
experiences.description:
Associate Academic Coach | Illinois Institute of Technology

As an Academic Coach at Illinois Institute of Technology, I guided undergraduate students towards achieving academic success through personalized coaching and strategic planning. My role encompassed:

- Study Planning:Empowering students to develop effective study plans tailored to their learning styles and academic goals.
- Time Management: Providing strategies and techniques to optimize time management, allowing students to balance coursework, extracurriculars, and personal commitments.
- Resource Utilization:Teaching students how to leverage university resources, including libraries, academic support services, and online tools, for enhanced learning.
- Assignment Mastery: Assisting students in excelling in assignments by offering guidance on research, writing, and project management.
- Bi-weekly Google meet Sessions: Organizing and facilitating interactive sessions via Gmeet to address challenges, provide guidance, and foster a supportive academic community.

By collaborating closely with students, I fostered a culture of academic excellence, empowering them to thrive both academically and personally

experiences.title: Software QA Engineer
experiences.description:
●  Carrying out the overall Quality Assurance processes for a funded application, Work and Communications
(WAC) using tools like PCloudy, Android Studio, Postman, Appium, Git, Trello, G-Sheets, and Zeplin.
●   Setting the Quality Assurance (QA) methodologies, test planning, and designing test case templates; also,
checking for Android and iOS versions and keeping the application available for all the latest versions.
●   Testing and designing test cases (manual and automation), demonstrating the functionalities incorporated,
implementing modifications and maintenance
●   Interacting with the clients to review business specifications; also, creating new tables, views, and indexes where ever needed

experiences.title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
experiences.description:
●   Designed test cases, demonstrated the functionalities;
●   Incorporated, implemented modifications suggested by designers and the client for UI and functionality
changes, and deployed the product on the client's installation.
●   Responsible for different types of testing Smoke, Functional, Integration, System, Adhoc, Network,
Internationalization, API testing - Postman
●   Designed and implemented automated testing tools such as Selenium and Appium.
●   Programs addressing areas including database impacts, software scenarios, regression testing, negative
testing, error/bug retests, and usability.
